definition[0]: a special design put onto paper, especially bank notes, that can only be seen when you hold it up to the light
definition[1]: a special mark contained in electronic documents, pictures, music etc that is used to stop people from copying them
example[1]: The card has a digital watermark detectable only by electronic cash dispensers.
definition[2]: a design that is put into paper that you can see when you hold it up to the light
example[2]: Banknotes have a watermark to prevent forgery.
definition[3]: an electronic device in text, pictures, music etc in DIGITAL form, showing where they came from. Watermarks can be used to fight against illegal copying
example[3]: A digital watermark through music bought over the Internet will show the original purchaser.
